title: The number of k-potent elements in the quaternion algebra HZp
abstract:
In this paper we count the number of k-potent elements over HZp , the
quaternion algebra over Zp, and we give a descriptive formula for the general
case. For k in {3, 4, 5}, we give an explicit formula for these values.
Moreover, as an application, we count the number of solutions of the equation
xk = 1 over HZp .
